ref: 13644 skámbhana n. ʻ prop, pillar ʼ RV., skambhanīˊ -- f. VS. [√skambh]
M. khã̄bṇī f. ʻ small post ʼ; --
G. khāmṇiyũ n. ʻ one of the ropes with which bucket is let down a well ʼ (i.e. from the post?); --
Or. khamaṇa ʻ pit, hole, waterchannel, lowland at foot of mountain ʼ;
G. khāmṇũ n. ʻ small depression to stand round -- bottomed vessel in, basin at root of a tree for water ʼ: semant. cf. kū́pa -- 1 and skambhá -- 1.
